item.title: Window Heat INOP Lights – Associated System Operative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated window heat system is verified to be operative before each departure.

placard.para: Placard appropriate Window Heat Light (P5) "LIGHT INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify operation of Window Heat System as follows:
Provide electrical power to left and right main AC buses.
Press four WINDOW HEAT switches on P5 panel to OFF (OUT) position.
Verify the WINDOW HEAT message appears on the EICAS display. (This is an advisory level message.)
Press four WINDOW HEAT switches (P5) to ON (latched-in) position.
Verify none of the following EICAS messages are displayed (these are advisory level messages):
WINDOW HEAT
L SIDE WINDOW
L FWD WINDOW
R SIDE WINDOW
R FWD WINDOW
Press the L FWD WINDOW HEAT Switch (P5) to the INOP (out) position.
Verify L FWD WINDOW message appears on the EICAS display.
Press the L FWD WINDOW HEAT switch (P5) to the ON (latched-in) position.
Press the R FWD WINDOW HEAT switch (P5) to the INOP (out) position.
Verify the R FWD WINDOW message appears on the EICAS display.
Press the R FWD WINDOW HEAT switch (P5) to the ON (latched-in) position.
Press the L SIDE WINDOW HEAT switch (P5) to the INOP (out) position.
Verify the L SIDE WINDOW message appears on the EICAS display.
Press the L SIDE WINDOW HEAT switch (P5) to the ON (latched-in) position.
Press the R SIDE WINDOW HEAT switch (P5) to the INOP (out) position.
Verify the R SIDE WINDOW message appears on the EICAS display.
Press the R SIDE WINDOW HEAT switch (P5) to the ON (latched-in) position.
Remove electrical power if no longer required.
